content:
Exit是一个夏季音乐节，在塞尔维亚诺维萨德的彼得罗瓦拉丁堡垒举行。它成立于2000年，在2013年和2017年两次获得欧洲节日奖的最佳主要节日奖。EXIT还在2007年获得了英国节日奖的 "欧洲最佳节日 "奖。2018年3月，区域合作委员会授予EXIT节为2017年度区域合作冠军。

 

历史

该节日于2000年在塞尔维亚的诺维萨德成立，是一个学生运动，为塞尔维亚和巴尔干地区的民主和自由而奋斗。 2000年南斯拉夫大选后，Exit从该市的大学公园搬到了同一城市的Petrovaradin堡垒。 尽管如此，社会责任仍然是节日活动的关键方面。 2007年2月，音乐节的管理层将音乐节让给了诺维萨德的执政党，这让出了政治变化和有问题的观点，与音乐节最初所依据的运动相悖。

 

2007年，Exit赢得了英国节日奖的最佳海外节日奖，并在Yourope奖中被评为最佳欧洲节日，它在2013年和2017年赢得了欧洲节日奖的最佳主要节日奖。

 

2006年，The Observer将Exit列为其25个顶级旅游体验名单中的节日选择。《卫报》将其列入 "2008年12个顶级旅行"。 2011年，CNN的国际版《CNN世界嘉年华》将Exit列入世界九个最佳音乐节名单。2013年，Euronews在其挑选的10个欧洲音乐节中将Exit列为第六。 2018年BBC新闻指出，Exit是世界上最大的音乐节之一，接待了来自60个国家的20多万人。2019年6月，福布斯发表文章称，"由于即将举行的EXIT节，塞尔维亚现在是一个值得你关注的新节日热点" 。

 

2006-2007年塞尔维亚超级品牌将Exit列为七个公共城市形象超级品牌之一。2018年3月在波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那的萨拉热窝，区域合作委员会授予Exit节为2017年区域合作冠军。

 

Exit在东南欧的五个国家组织了六个活动：五月的Sea Star Festival (Umag, Croatia) ；八月的Revolution Festival (Timișoara, Romania) ；七月的Exit Festival (Novi Sad, Serbia) ；七月的Sunland节（保加利亚的普里莫尔斯科）；八月的Sea Dance Festival （黑山的布德瓦）；以及十一月的无眠节（塞尔维亚的贝尔格莱德）。 由于COVID-19大流行，Exit集团在2020年组织的音乐节被推迟到2021年，除了Exit音乐节，起初被推迟到2020年8月，但最终被推迟到2021年7月，在2020年9月组织4天直播版， 每天只允许250人参加直播， 还有Sea Star Festival，已被推迟到2022年。 此前，Exit还组织了 Festival 84（波斯尼亚和黑塞哥维那的Jahorina山），由于组织者无法控制行政问题，该节在2019年2月被取消。

 

2021年7月，该节日成为COVID-19疫情开始后在欧洲举行的第一个大型节日。 它每天接待约40,000名与会者，并在离首都贝尔格莱德一小时的地方举行。
contentEn:
Exit (Serbian: Егзит, romanized: Egzit; stylized as EXIT, Serbian: ЕГЗИТ, romanized: EGZIT) is a summer music festival which is held at the Petrovaradin Fortress in Novi Sad, Serbia. Founded in 2000, it has twice won the Best Major Festival award at the European Festivals Awards, for 2013 and 2017. EXIT has also won the "Best European Festival" award at the UK Festival Awards in 2007. In March 2018 Regional Cooperation Council awarded EXIT Festival as Champion of Regional Cooperation for 2017.[2]

 

History

The festival was founded in 2000 in Novi Sad, Serbia as a student movement, fighting for democracy and freedom in Serbia and the Balkans. After the Yugoslavian general election in 2000, Exit moved from the city's university park to the Petrovaradin Fortress in the same city in 2001. Nonetheless, social responsibility is still key aspect of the festival activities. In February 2007, management of the festival has given away the festival to the ruling political party in Novi Sad, which gave away the political change and the questionable views, contrary to the movement upon which the festival was initially based upon.[3]

 

In 2007 Exit won the Best Overseas Festival award at the UK Festival Awards[4] and was voted Best European Festival at the Yourope Awards.[5] It won the Best Major Festival award at the European Festivals Awards in 2013[6] and 2017.[7]

 

In 2006 The Observer listed Exit as its festival pick in its list of top 25 travel experiences.[8] The Guardian listed it in "12 top trips for 2008".[9] The international edition of CNN, CNN World Fiesta, included Exit on the list of nine best music festivals in the world in 2011.[10] In 2013 Euronews listed Exit as sixth in its pick of 10 European music festivals.[11] In 2018 BBC News noted Exit as one of the world's largest music festivals, hosting more than 200,000 people from 60 countries.[12] In June 2019 Forbes published an article claiming that "Thanks to the upcoming EXIT Festival, Serbia is now a new festival hot spot worth your attention".[13]

 

Superbrands Serbia 2006–2007 listed Exit as one of seven public urban identity superbrands.[14] In March 2018 in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, the Regional Cooperation Council awarded the Exit Festival as Champion of Regional Cooperation for 2017.[15]

 

Exit organizes six events in five countries in South-East Europe: Sea Star Festival (Umag, Croatia) in May; Revolution Festival (Timișoara, Romania) in August; Exit Festival (Novi Sad, Serbia) in July; Sunland Festival (Primorsko, Bulgaria) In July; Sea Dance Festival (Budva, Montenegro) in August; and No Sleep Festival (Belgrade, Serbia) in November.[16][17] Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic, festivals organized by the Exit group in 2020 have been postponed until 2021,[18][19] except the Exit Festival, which has been pushed back to August 2020 at first,[20] but ultimately postponed until July 2021,[21] with a 4-day live-stream edition organized in September 2020,[22] and only 250 daily attenders allowed live,[23] and Sea Star Festival, which has been postponed until 2022. Previously, Exit also organized Festival 84 (Jahorina Mountain, Bosnia and Herzegovina), which was cancelled in February 2019 due to administrative reasons beyond the organizers' control.[24][25][26][27]

 

In July 2021, the festival became the first major festival to be held in Europe since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic. It hosted c. 40,000 attendees per day and took place an hour away from capital Belgrade.[28]

remarks:

name: Exit Festival
descriptions: Exit是一个夏季音乐节，在塞尔维亚诺维萨德的彼得罗瓦拉丁堡垒举行。它成立于2000年，在2013年和2017年两次获得欧洲节日奖的最佳主要节日奖。EXIT还在2007年获得了英国节日奖的 "欧洲最佳节日 "奖。2018年3月，区域合作委员会授予EXIT节为2017年度区域合作冠军。
holdTimeText: Four days, starting on the second Thursday of July
